DOC.brief_title: Semilunar Coronally Positioned Flap With Without Enamel Matrix Derivative Treatment Gingival Recessions
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study evaluate clinically use Semilunar Coronally Positioned Flap ( SCPF ) treatment gingival recession , without Enamel Matrix Derivative ( EMD ) . Thirty patient select , randomize allocate two group : test group ( SCPF + EMD ) control group ( SCPF ) . The subject present buccal Miller class I gingival recession height great equal 2.0 mm less 4.0 mm maxillary canine premolar . Clinical parameter evaluate : gingival recession height ( GRH ) , gingival recession width ( GRW ) , clinical attachment level ( CAL ) , probe depth ( PD ) , height ( HKT ) thickness ( TKT ) keratinize tissue papilla height ( HP ) width ( LP ) , well plaque gingival index . These data collect baseline 180 day surgery .
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 18 year ; Presence least one Miller Class I gingival recession ≥ 2 mm ≤ 4mm maxillary canine premolar identifiable cementumenamel junction ( CEJ ) ; Height keratinize tissue ≥ 2 mm ; Aesthetic complaint and/or presence dentin hypersensitivity air stimulus ; Fullmouth visible plaque index ≤ 20 % ( Ainamo & Bay 1975 ) ; Fullmouth sulcus bleed index ≤ 20 % ( Mühlemann & Son 1971 ) . Smoking ; Pregnancy ; Presence systemic disorder ( diabetes , hypertension , heart disease condition could contraindicate periodontal surgery ) ; Use medication ( immunosuppressant , phenytoin anything else might affect mucosal heal repair ) ; Previous periodontal surgery area .
